question: Which club does Fernando Vega play for?

content.source_1:
**BREAKING NEWS**

Spanish Footballer Fernando Vega Joins Sevilla Atlético Ranks

Seville, Spain - In a move that is set to shake up the Spanish football scene, Fernando Vega, the talented 38-year-old midfielder, has officially signed with Sevilla Atlético, the reserve team of Sevilla FC. According to sources close to the club, Vega put pen to paper on a one-year deal with the Andalusian outfit, bringing an end to speculation about his future. The move is seen as a major coup for Sevilla Atlético, who are looking to bolster their squad ahead of the upcoming season. "Fernando is a top-class player with a wealth of experience," said Sevilla Atlético's coach, José María Amores, in an exclusive interview. "We're thrilled to have him on board and believe he will be a valuable addition to our team." Vega, who has made over 200 appearances in his professional career, has played for several clubs in Spain's lower divisions, including CD San Fernando and Real Jaén. His impressive form and versatility on the pitch caught the attention of Sevilla Atlético's scouts, who were keen to bring him to the Ramón Sánchez Pizjuán Stadium. "I'm delighted to join Sevilla Atlético and grateful for the opportunity to play for such a prestigious club," Vega said in a statement. "I'm looking forward to working with the coaching staff and my new teammates to achieve success this season." Data from Transfermarkt, a leading football statistics website, confirms that Vega has indeed signed with Sevilla Atlético, with the deal reportedly worth €200,000. This move is seen as a significant boost to Sevilla Atlético's promotion hopes, with the team looking to bounce back from a disappointing 10th-place finish in Segunda División B last season. "Fernando's experience and quality will undoubtedly strengthen our squad and give us a better chance of achieving our goals," said Sevilla Atlético's sporting director, Ramón Rodríguez Verdejo. With Vega's signing, Sevilla Atlético has sent a clear message to their rivals that they mean business this season. As the team prepares for the upcoming campaign, fans will be eagerly anticipating the midfielder's debut and the impact he will have on the pitch. **FACT CHECK**

* Fernando Vega was born in 1984 and is a Spanish footballer. * Sevilla Atlético is an association football club and the reserve team of Sevilla FC.

**CHICAGO COBRAS LAND SHOCK SIGNING WITH SPANISH VETERAN FERNANDO VEGA**

In a stunning move, the Chicago Cobras, a semi-professional women's soccer team, has announced the signing of Spanish footballer Fernando Vega, a 38-year-old veteran with a storied career in Europe. Vega, born in 1984, has played for several top-tier clubs in Spain, including Real Madrid's B team and Segunda División side, CD Numancia. The midfielder has accumulated over 200 professional appearances, scoring 35 goals and providing 50 assists throughout his career. The Cobras' management team, led by General Manager, Rachel Patel, revealed that Vega was attracted to the team's commitment to developing women's soccer in the Midwest and its strong community ties. "Fernando's experience and leadership will be invaluable to our team," Patel said in a statement. "We're thrilled to have him on board and believe he'll be an excellent role model for our players." Vega, who arrived in Chicago last week, expressed his excitement about joining the Cobras. "I've always been passionate about promoting women's soccer, and the opportunity to play for the Chicago Cobras was too good to pass up," he said in an exclusive interview. "I'm looking forward to contributing to the team's success and helping to grow the sport in the region." The signing has sent shockwaves through the women's soccer community, with many praising the Cobras' bold move. "Fernando Vega is a fantastic player with a wealth of experience," said Sarah Taylor, a sports analyst for ESPN. "His addition will undoubtedly elevate the level of competition in the league and provide a unique opportunity for the Cobras' players to learn from a seasoned pro." Vega is expected to make his debut for the Cobras in their upcoming match against the Detroit Dynamos on April 15th. The team's coach, Maria Rodriguez, is confident that Vega's presence will make an immediate impact. "Fernando's vision and passing range will create scoring opportunities for our forwards, and his defensive skills will help solidify our backline," Rodriguez said. The Cobras, who finished third in the Midwest Women's Soccer League last season, are looking to make a strong push for the championship title this year. With Vega on board, they may just have the edge they need to take their game to the next level.
